definition: muqam, Uyghur melody types that are the basis for a set of suites
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor

sentences.english: Later, the names of her three sons became the names of the Muqam suites.
sentences.chinese: 後來，這三個兒子的名字就成了木卡姆套曲的名稱。

sentences.english: Xinjiang Muqam is a masterpiece of intangible cultural heritages in China.
sentences.chinese: 新疆木卡姆是中國非物質文化遺產代表作之一。

sentences.english: Dulan Muqam is the cultural legacy of human hunting society.
sentences.chinese: 刀郎木卡姆是人類狩獵社會的文化遺存。

definition: Dombra or Tambura, Kazakh plucked lute
genre of song-and-dance duet popular in Inner Mongolia
sihu (or "khuurchir" in Mongolian), a bowed instrument with four strings, primarily associated with Mongolian and Chinese culture
Qinqiang, an opera style popular in northwest China, possibly originating in Ming dynasty folk music/Shaanxi opera
